Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Pulmonary Endarterectomy for Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted across four leading CTEPH centers.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with a confirmed diagnosis of operable CTEPH.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either undergo PEA or receive standard medical therapy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) at 6 months post-intervention.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured through sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the PEA group and 100 to the control group, during the recruitment period from January 2020 to June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, 98 participants in the PEA group and 97 in the control group were analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The PEA group demonstrated a significant reduction in PVR compared to the control group (mean difference = 5.2 mm Hg, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were observed in 3/100 (3%) of the PEA group and 1/98 (1%) of the control group, primarily mild gastrointestinal side-effects.

Funding.evidence: This research did not receive any specific grant from funding agencies in the public, commercial, or not-for-profit sectors.
